A form with this name already exists: A form with this name already exists
Create a new form or edit an existing fo: Create a new form or edit an existing form
Enter the name for your form, for exampl: Enter the name for your form, for example Applying for visitors pass
Select an existing form to edit: Select an existing form to edit
Test: For testing purpose, do not delete it

addLink.hint1: You can add links between different pages and set conditions for links to control the page that loads next. For example, a question page with a component for yes and no options could have link conditions based on which option a user selects.
addLink.hint2: To add a link in the main screen, click and hold the title of a page and drag a line to the title of the page you want to link it to. To edit a link, select its line.
addLink.noFieldsAvailable: You cannot add any conditions as there are no components on the page you wish to link from. Add a component, such as an Input or a Selection field, and then add a condition.

component.contentfields_info: Content components allow you to add information to your page
component.create_info: Select a component to add to your page. If your page has only one component, the component title does not show on the page. To name or describe the component, use the page title.
component.inputfields_info: Input fields allow you to ask users to enter information
component.name: Component name
component.selectfields_info: Selection fields allow you to provide lists of answers for users to choose from

conditions.addOrEditHint: Set the rules that determine the conditional behaviour in the form flow. For example, a question page might have a component for yes and no options that need two conditions - one to control what happens if a user selects yes and one for when a user selects no.
conditions.displayNameHint: Set a condition name that is easy to recognise. It appears as an option in the settings menus for the pages, components and links in a form.
conditions.hint: Set conditions for components and links to control the flow of a form. For example, a question page with a component for yes and no options could have link conditions based on which option a user selects.
conditions.noFieldsAvailable: You cannot add a condition as no components are available. Create a component on a page in the form. You can then add a condition.
conditions.whenHint: Set when a condition might be met in the form. For example, when the form asks a question and the user selects Yes instead of No (yes=true).
conditions.youCannotEditWarning: You cannot edit this condition '{{conditionString}}'. Please recreate it in the editor below to continue

enterDateTimeAsGmt: Dates and times should be GMT timezone

fieldTypeToName.AutocompleteField_info: Sets a list of values to suggest to users as they complete this field
fieldTypeToName.CheckboxesField_info: A list for users to select multiple answers
fieldTypeToName.DateField_info: A calendar for users to specify a date
fieldTypeToName.DatePartsField_info: Allows users to manually enter a Day, Month and Year
fieldTypeToName.DateTimeField_info: A calendar and clock for users to specify a date and time
fieldTypeToName.DateTimePartsField_info: Allows users to manually enter a Day, Month, Year, Hour and Minute
fieldTypeToName.Details_info: An expandable title that lets users reveal more detailed information only if they need it
fieldTypeToName.EmailAddressField_info: A text box that users can enter an email address into
fieldTypeToName.FileUploadField_info: Allows users to upload files from the device they are using
fieldTypeToName.FlashCard_info: A panel of text that can include a list
fieldTypeToName.Html_info: A block of text you can apply basic HTML to, such as text formatting and hyperlinks
fieldTypeToName.InsetText_info: A block of text that differentiates it from surrounding content, for example for quotes
fieldTypeToName.MultilineTextField_info: A text box for users to enter multiple lines of text into, for example as 'Additional info'
fieldTypeToName.NumberField_info: A text box that users can only enter numbers into
fieldTypeToName.RadiosField_info: A list for users to select one answer
fieldTypeToName.SelectField_info: A drop-down list for users to select one answer
fieldTypeToName.TelephoneNumberField_info: A text box that users can enter numbers and some symbols into, such as '+'
fieldTypeToName.TextField_info: A text box that users can enter letters, numbers and symbols into
fieldTypeToName.TimeField_info: A clock for users to specify a time
fieldTypeToName.UkAddressField_info: Allows users to enter their street address, town or city and postcode
fieldTypeToName.YesNoField_info: Allows users to answer either 'Yes' or 'No'

phaseBanner.fieldHint: A feedback form is used to gather feedback from users about another form
phaseBanner.fieldTitle: Select a phase banner to add or change to your form
phaseBanner.hint: A phase banner includes a link for users to give feedback on your form.

choice.heading: Design and prototype forms
choice.intro: Use the form designer to easily create,edit forms and test ideas

existing.noforms: You do not have any existing forms

leaveDesigner: Are you sure you want to leave the Designer? If you have unsaved changes they will be lost.

deleteWarning.message: If you delete this list, it will be deleted across the entire form
deleteWarning.title: Deleting this list?

errors.empty: The list must have list items

item.conditionsHint: The item will only be shown if the selected condition applies
item.subComponentHint: You need a sub component if the list item answer needs more information, for example an email address. This will only be shown when the user selects this list item.
item.title: Item title
item.valueHint: This will not show on the page. If the list item is answered with words, you can use the item title, for example 'email'. If the list item is answered with a number, use a number with no letters or symbols, for example 1000

static.saveFirst: You must save before creating a component list, or you can select an existing list

list.title: List title
list.titleHint: This will not show on the page.

name.hint: This has been generated automatically, it will not show on the page. You usually wont need to change it unless an integration requires it. It must not contain spaces.

page.pathHint: The path of this page e.g. /personal-details
page.sectionHint: The section title is shown above the page title. If the page and the section title are the same, the section title wont show.
page.title: Page title

title: Title
wontShow: This will not show on the page.
